Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on creamy, thin paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration]  tamām shud qarābazīn az Kitāb-i Zakhīrah /1/ bi-'awn Allāh wa-husn tawfīqih wa-faragha min tahrīrih waqt al-duhá yawm al-ithnayn /2/ thānī wa-'ishrūn shahr Rabī' al-thānī sanat tis' wa-thamānīn wa-thamānmi<'>ah /3/ al-hilālīyah 'alá yad al-faqīr al-da'īf al-muhtāj ilá /4/ rahmat Allāh Malik (?) al-Samad Muhammad bn Mahrūf bn Muhammad al-Zarīr (?)/5/ al-Kāzarūnī al-maysūm [sic] bi-Shīrānī aslaha Allāh ahwālahu /6/ rahmat-i Allāh ta'ālá hāsil bāz kih /7/ kātib rā bi-fātihat al-Kitāb /8/ va sūrat al-Ikhlās /9/ va da'ā… (?) /10/ yāz āvarad /11/ al-salam[?] /12/ m (= tamma) /13/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.595 contains a colophon.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Book; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Manuscript; Contemporary Binding; Iran; Science -- Medicine
Provenance: 'Ali [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [ownership statement (min kutub) and seal on fol. 1a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Zayn al-Din Isma'il ibn Hasan al-Jurjani (died 531 AH/AD 1136)
